page.title: 02Manor farm, Landford
page.content: Manor farm Landford is up Stock Lane just off the A36 by Landford Manor.The farmer has owned the farm since 1950, 35 years altogether.It is a farm mainly for cows but other animals are there.He keeps 190 cows and 2 bulls,and 55 calves about 9 months old.He can only keep a certain number of cows because he can only give a certain amount of milk to Unigate in Southampton.In the morning one of the workers rounds up the cows on a motorbike and they all go to be milked.One of the cows is the thinnest but it gives the most milk.One cow usually gives 21 or 22 litres of milk a day.We saw 2 big tanks which altogether hold 4000 litres of milk in one day.The cow is pregrant for 280 days or 9 months.The birth can be short if all goes well.
